description: A collection of circles in a long diamond-shaped formation with longer bottom sides than top; there is also a small triangular formation with the point at the bottom extending upwards from the top of the diamond-shaped formation. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a light tan triangle above the center of the diamond-shaped formation and a grayish-brown triangle below the center.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
